actions.actionName: FINAL TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD, ST. THOMAS HARBOR, UNITED STATES VIRGIN ISLANDS

documents.documentComments: Legacy document:Other Supporting Documents (e.g., MOUs, MOAs)

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText: THE BIOLOGICAL OXYGEN DEMAND (BOD)  & SEDIMENT OXYGEN DEMAND (SOD) ARE THE SURROGATE PARAMETERS FOR ST. THOMAS HARBOR. THE TARGET TMDL VALUES FOR DISSOLVED OXYGEN  ARE THE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS OF   5.5 MG/L  FOR CLASS B WATERS AND 5.0 MG/L FOR CLASS B WATERS.

THE TMDL TARGET IS THE FECAL COLIFORM WATER QUALITY STANDARD (WQS) FOR CLASS B WATER IS NOT TO EXCEED  70 FECAL COLIFORMS TO 100 ML BY MF OR MPN AND THE WQS FOR CLASS C WATER IS NOT TO EXCEED 200 COLIFORMS PER 100 ML BY MF OR MPN.

THE BIOLOGICAL OXYGEN DEMAND (BOD)  & SEDIMENT OXYGEN DEMAND (SOD) ARE THE SURROGATE PARAMETERS FOR ST. THOMAS HARBOR. THE TARGET TMDL VALUES FOR DISSOLVED OXYGEN  ARE THE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS OF   5.5 MG/L  FOR CLASS B WATERS AND 5.0 MG/L FOR CLASS B WATERS.

THE TMDL   TARGETS FOR ENTEROCOCCI BACTERIA IS THE WQS FOR CLASS B AND CLASS C WATERS NOT TO EXCEED A GEOMETRIC MEAN OF 35 ENTEROCOCCI PER 100ML, NOT TO EXCEED A SINGLE SAMPLE MAXIMUM OF 104 PER ML AT ANY TIME.
